intro: Cyphostemma vezensis, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. Cyphostemma vezensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
